HDG.IM.content: [Heidegger on Marx] spirit as intelligence becomes powerless superstructure to something else, counts as authentic because spirit-less > Marxism in its most extreme form understands spirit as intelligence [?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: [Heidegger on Marx] spirit as intelligence becomes powerless superstructure to something else, counts as authentic because spirit-less > Marxism in its most extreme form understands spirit as intelligence [?]

HDG.BC.content: to be equivalent (Gleiche) something other/additional (mehreres) is needed [Marx & commodity] > to be the same (Selbe), only uniqueness is needed > as the same & unique, Being is forever different from/in itself (but different not in the sense of twice over, repeatedly (mehrmal), or able to be split into multiplicity), incomparable distinction
HDG.BC.linkedContent: to be equivalent (Gleiche) something other/additional (mehreres) is needed [Marx & commodity] > to be the same (Selbe), only uniqueness is needed > as the same & unique, Being is forever different from/in itself (but different not in the sense of twice over, repeatedly (mehrmal), or able to be split into multiplicity), incomparable distinction

HDG.QB.content: [how can Heidegger see Being if Ge-stell? the Marx dilemma]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: [how can Heidegger see Being if Ge-stell? the Marx dilemma]

HDG.FS.content: standing opposites presupposes statement as proposition (Aussage), both appear [day/night] through play of negation [Heidegger discusses dialectic and its use of contradiction to make up truth, referencing Marx]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: standing opposites presupposes statement as proposition (Aussage), both appear [day/night] through play of negation [Heidegger discusses dialectic and its use of contradiction to make up truth, referencing Marx]

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger somewhat aligns himself w/ Marx, though he insists via question that every interpretation [of genuine thinking] can/must lead to transformation (Veränderung) of world > Heidegger also insists that praxis in Marx is determined by a theory of production as production of human itself (founded in Hegelian philosophy) > theory/praxis: sisters born from unknown parents [baby daddy]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger somewhat aligns himself w/ Marx, though he insists via question that every interpretation [of genuine thinking] can/must lead to transformation (Veränderung) of world > Heidegger also insists that praxis in Marx is determined by a theory of production as production of human itself (founded in Hegelian philosophy) > theory/praxis: sisters born from unknown parents [baby daddy]

HDG.FS.content: Marx reverses Hegel’s idealism (uniquely), requires that Being be given precedence over consciousness [?] > for Marx, Being is production process, receives this representation from metaphysics via Hegel’s interpretation of life as process
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Marx reverses Hegel’s idealism (uniquely), requires that Being be given precedence over consciousness [?] > for Marx, Being is production process, receives this representation from metaphysics via Hegel’s interpretation of life as process

HDG.FS.content: Marx (like Feuerbach): “criticism of religion ends w/ teaching that man is the highest being for man” > Heidegger’s Marx interpretation not political, concerned w/ Being in manner it destines itself: w/ Marx, position of most extreme nihilism is reached [what about Nietzsche?] > if man is the highest being for man, Being (as Being) is nothing (nichts) (nihil) anymore for man > to understand Marx politically: make politics a mode of self-production (perfectly consistent w/ Marx’s thought) (Marx’s statement decidedly metaphysical)
